timeline.bodyText:
Two questions here:

serveDevModeRequest  looks too late for checking.
I think this may be preserved BUT this could be just double check.
why it sets HttpServletResponse.SC_NOT_MODIFIED ?

Clarification:
isDevModeRequest should be called before serveDevModeRequest (if I understand correctly).
The method should return just false  and then some other handler will be used to handle a request or some status (404 most likely , but this doesn't matter) will be set.
Double check here can be done but then the code should just throw: since isDevModeRequest should be checked first by design and serveDevModeRequest shouldn't be ever called.
If it's called then our imp is broken and we should just throw.
timeline.author: denis-anisimov

replies.bodyText:
The method should return just false and then some other handler will be used to handle a request or some status

I agree to make a path check more early, in isDevModeRequest, but if we just return false and delegate to another handler, then the path check occurs twice. Is that correct and why not just terminate the request handling?

why it sets HttpServletResponse.SC_NOT_MODIFIED ?

Good question and I also thinking about that. The response code should reflect the semantics of rejecting the request, maybe 403 Forbidden is better here.

Double check here can be done but then the code should just throw: since isDevModeRequest should be checked first by design and serveDevModeRequest shouldn't be ever called.
If it's called then our imp is broken and we should just throw.

Agree!  serveDevModeRequest potentially could be called directly, because it's public, so let double check and throw if needed.

timeline.bodyText:
I would rename the method to have different name than pathsWithDirectoryChange: they have quite different nature (at least the types are different) event though they are connected.
Another thing : I'm pretty sure that DevModeHandlerTest should not be made parameterized .
As I understand when you parameterize the class its instance is created per every parameter AND for every test method.
So if you have N parameters and M test methods then there will be N*M executed tests.
Since this class contains tests which don't need any parameters this is very excessive and will increase the time of execution dramatically.
So: either the method should accept parameter and there should be just one test method per parameter (hardcoded) or the class should be refactored to contain only test methods which really requires parameters.

timeline.bodyText:
test-root-context  doesn't use dev mode.
it compiles the resources and web pack dev server is not started.
It should not be changed because these tests are used for OSGi which is not able to run webpack dev server at all.
So the IT which relies on webpack dev server will fail there.
There are a bunch of modules which are executed in dev mode. E.g. test-dev-mode  which is explicitly made for dev mode. Please use another module for the test.
